title: Nara Deer
description: Everyone gets the same basic photo feeding the deer here, so I had to do something to one-up that, obviously.

title: Super Mario World at Universal
description: Was so keen for this, honestly do not recommend everything here was for kids.

title: Claw Machine Win
description: Jassu and I watched two Japanese girls spend 20 minutes trying to win on this claw machine in Dotonburi, came up with a strategy and got this Luffy first try. We could have been nice and given it to them, but I guess we weren't feeling generous.

title: Himeji Castle
description: Would highly recommend jumping off the bullet train to see Himeji castle. It's in excellent condition and we were able to jump in on a free tour. Learning about Hideyoshi's unification of Japan and invasion of China was amazing, especially after reading about his mentor Oda Nobunaga in Kyoto.

title: Hiroshima Castle
description: It's dark because we spent too much time at the Pokemon center and eating okonomiyaki (it's way better in Hiroshima than anywhere else I've had it).

title: Hiroshima Pokemon Center
description: Obviously #1 on the list of must-see things in the city, the shiny Gyarados statue.

title: Beach Weather
description: Cycled to the beach from our resort and got caught in a torrential downpour. We swam anyway. While we were there a granpda came up to us asking where we were from, and we ended up talking to his extended family (and taking pictures with them) for an hour.

title: Kumamoto Castle
description: Another cool castle. We wanted to climb the volcano in Kumamoto, but we figured the buses would be done when we got back, and didn't feel like spending a night on the mountainside if there were no taxis. Also Oda from One Piece is from here!

title: Penny Pinching
description: This was about 5 hours before our flight. We wanted to get the train to this electronics district, but we didn't want to get more cash out and pay transaction fees for a few dollars. Yes we (just) had enough in the end.

title: Hakata Train Station Tonkotsu
description: I don't have that many food pics, but I had to include this because it's genuinely the best meal I've ever had. Holy shit. This is worth the trip to Fukuoka by itself.

title: Fjord Kayaking
description: test

title: Heli Evac
description: So remember I mentioned the heavy rain and avalanche zone before? Well we got caught between a flood and a high avalanche risk, so they helicoptered everyone off the track. Which sucks, but we also got a free scenic helicopter ride, so it could be worse.

title: Testing out the Waterproof Gear
description: Conclusion: not waterproof enough for this. The blowback from the waterfall was so strong I actually couldn't stand near it, I had to kinda crawl my way closer.

title: Sutherland Falls
description: While the heavy rain may have caused us other problems, it did mean we got some good waterfalls. Sutherland falls are 580m, the highest in New Zealand.

title: Dudleigh Falls
description: Had to put myself and my camera in quite a precarious position to get this picture. Fortunately there wasn't any unplanned white water rafting.

title: The Way Down
description: This bit of the track is known as bomb alley, because in winter avalanches go down the hill into the valley and it sounds like bombs going off. This will become relevant later...

title: Another View of McKinnon Pass
description: This one is also looking very LOTR-esque.

title: McKinnon Pass
description: Rewarded myself for getting to the top with another swim. This one wasn't so nice. Apparently no one ever swims on here and the bottom was really slimy. I haven't succumbed to brain-eating amoeba yet, but if I do, they were from here.

title: Lake Mintaro
description: Dad basically ran up here from the last hut to show off. I'm not so keen on trail running with a 15kg backpack but I tried my best to keep up.

title: A Refreshing Swim
description: Water was pretty cold, but it was warm and sunny enough to be pleasant. What wasn't so pleasant was walking with wet undies for the rest of the day.

title: Erebor
description: This really made me feel like I was in Lord of the Rings.

title: First Steps
description: This (apparently) iconic bridge at Glade House marks the start of the Milford Track.

title: Stapafell
description: Not a bad stop for a quick break from driving.

title: More Seals
description: This was one of my favourite moments of the trip. Sitting on the beach in moderate rain, completely alone, watching a big group of seals play in the waves and roll around. There were signs saying not to go within 100m of them, but technically I sat down first and they came to me.

title: Rauðfeldsgjá Gorge
description: Walked about 500m up this random ravine before we started wondering if it could flood and turned back (also because we had absolutely no caving equipment).

title: Kirkjufell
description: Definitely the most cliché waterfall photo I got this trip. There were a few other good angles, but I get why this one is so popular - it's too good to not include.

title: Goðafoss Waterfall
description: Another waterfall. Had to take a nap on the side of the road after this because we were too tired to keep driving.

title: SIUUUUU
description: Not really why we came to Iceland but a cool side quest. CR7 89' winner. This stadium was small enough that there were kids standing on boxes to watch over the fence. I would totally have done the same if we couldn't get tickets.

title: Georgetown at Night
description: We had some of the best food of the trip in Georgetown, including traditional Nyonya (Chinese settlers to Malaysia) cuisine where they sat us in the back room for either being foreign or poorly dressed (or both), and samosas that were so good we walked 30 minutes back to get more right after we finished the first batch.

title: V-League Football Match
description: Tried to buy tickets online, reddit advised us to find them at the gate. There wasn't a ticket office, but we were able to find some police (?) with tickets to sell us, using google translate. As we were buying the tickets, a lady ran up, snatched them off the police and insisted she sell them to us instead. They argued for a bit but apparently this was ok, as we bought them off her and were let in. They even let me bring in beers, but unfortunately they couldn't crack one open with us, being on duty and all. Game was good. Most disgusting bathrooms I've ever used though.

title: Whale Tail
description: This is a humpback whale - much more curious and playful than the blue whale, and also part of a bigger pod.

title: Blue Whale Waves Hello
description: This photo doesn't do any justice to the moment - I haven't had much luck photographing sea creatures (probably a skill issue). Getting to see a blue whale up close was incredible. There are only a couple thousand in the arctic, of which maybe 100 pass through Icelandic waters annually on their way to arctic feeding grounds, before going all the way to the Caribbean to breed in winter. They are also very shy, hence the difficulty getting a photo that truly captures their scale.

title: Studlagil
description: I'm not sure I've ever seen such curvy rocks.

title: Ducklings
description: You can tell which parent is the favourite.

title: Breiðamerkurjökull
description: Yes I had to look up how to spell that. Breiðamerkurjökull is a branch of the Vatnajokull glacier (which covers 8% of Iceland!) This branch is slowly retreating, which feeds the glacier lagoon Jokulsarlon.

title: Iceberg
description: Spotted in Jokusarlon glacier lagoon.

title: Seal
description: Seal!

title: Mogafoss
description: Nice little walk up to this place with fields, sheep, and low hanging clouds. Very peaceful and refreshing. I would love to come back and hike or 4WD through the highlands for a week with no phone.

title: Lava Fields
description: Foreground is lava flows that cooled and had moss go on them. One of the most otherworldly places I have ever been. Iceland has so many different landscapes due to its high volcanic activity - it felt like a Minecraft map with so many biomes next to each other.

title: The Wisdom Path
description: Came here for the Big Buddha, but it wasn't as big as the other Big Buddha so here's some cool wood things instead. Almost missed the last cable car and as a result my flight home.

title: Snowmobiling
description: Went on a snowmobile tour of Vatnajokull glacier with the self-titled Crazy Sven. This guy showed us all the crevices we could fall down on his GPS, apparently up to 100m deep. Then, in heavy snow with very poor visibility he said 'follow me' and took off at max speed into the whiteness. I've never driven a snowmobile before that. Honestly top 10 scariest moments of my life. Good fun though. We also had a 1.5km drop kindly pointed out to us after we drove right past it.

title: Lupin
description: Technically an invasive plant, lupin grows here in very harsh conditions caused by volcanic activity. It deposits nitrogen and other minerals in the soil to allow other plants to grow. And I think it looks quite nice.

title: Black Sand Beach
description: They warn you not to go near the shore because of 'killer waves'. Unsure if they're genuinely dangerous or if they're normal-sized waves and people don't know how to swim.

title: Skogafoss
description: The last waterfall got me slightly damp. This one made me saturated. Probably my fault for standing under it, but in my defence I did have a raincoat on.

title: Skoga
description: Leading into Skogafoss, another big waterfall. Saw some sheep up here.

title: Seljalandsfoss
description: Waterfall #2. This one got me mildly wet. Some cool crevices in the rock and lots of pleasant streams and flowers.

title: Gullfoss
description: Believe it or not this was taken around midnight. Good way to make the most of jet lag.

title: Batu Caves
description: Almost got jumped by a pack of monkeys. I could've taken them though.

title: CNY Dinner
description: Lucky we got this reservation the day before new year, or it would've been maccas for dinner. Everything was delicious, I would actually say the fried bean curd rolls were my favourite. Hong Kong has made me a certified dim sum enjoyer.

title: The World's Game
description: Filled in for a futsal game. All the counterfeit jerseys I bought came in handy. Didn't score but kept a clean sheet playing CB in the second half.

title: Authentic Vietnamese Cuisine
description: Trying black chicken and fertilised duck egg with our new Vietnamese friend Max. Could be the numerous beers I had, but I quite enjoyed both (and the heart/intestine pho from earlier that night).

title: Ruins of Saint Paul's
description: After a delicious Portuguese lunch where I nailed the pronunciation of the Portuguese wine, just for the waitress to not understand until I said it wrong in an English pronunciation.

title: Ocean Park
description: Ocean Park had mid rides but the animals and gondola were cool.

title: Victoria Peak
description: Took 3 busses going past us without stopping to give up and get an uber here instead.

title: Baby Crocodile
description: This guy took me about a minute to spot after the guide pointed him out. Much less skittish than the adults - maybe he knew how good his camouflage was.

title: Cameron Highlands
description: Much needed cool weather, I see why the brits liked this place.

title: Uncle Ho
description: Paying my respects to the big boss.

title: Hoi An Lanterns
description: Lots of good deals on Yeezys going on here. Didn't have much luck bargaining - we got laughed out of the store :(.

title: Cat Cat Village
description: The village so nice they named it twice (it actually wasn't that nice, but getting about an hour of sleep on the train up and not eating may have contributed to that).

title: View of Mt. Fansipan
description: This was apparently the first time my guide had seen sun in 10 days. Nice of the clouds to move for me.

title: Sa Pa Rice Fields
description: Not quite as picturesque in January

title: Big Buddha
description: I've seen a few Buddhas in my time, but this one was looking particularly enlightened. This is at the summit of Mt. Fansipan, the highest peak in Indochina. I wonder how they got him up here...

title: Semmenggoh Orangutan Sanctuary
description: We were lucky enough to see one daddy orangutan and a few smaller ones.

title: Langkawi Sky Bridge
description: One of a few cable car rides from the trip. This one had the steepest segment of any in the world (or something like that).

title: Langkawi Jetski Tour
description: Highlight of the trip - taking jetskis on the open ocean and getting to visit a bunch of islands.
